definition: the Book of Dao by Laozi or Lao-Tze, the sacred text of Daoism

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]
virtue/goodness/morality/ethics/kindness/favor/character/kind
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
surname Jing

sentences.english: This chapter of Tao Te Ching is usually being called Great Conformity.
sentences.chinese: 這篇道德經一般人稱之謂大順。

sentences.english: Lao Tze's philosophy contains the perfect ecosystem intelligence and the humanities spirit.
sentences.chinese: 古老的《道德經》蘊含着完善的生態智慧和人文精神。

sentences.english: The tao-te handed down for the first Taoist books.
sentences.chinese: 《道德經》爲道教始祖老子唯一傳世的著作。

sentences.english: Laotse, "The Old Boy, " always emphasized in his Taotehching the unearned rock.
sentences.chinese: 老子在他的《道德經》裏始終看重不雕琢的石頭。

sentences.english: TTC Lao Tzu. Tao Te Ching. Reference is to section number.
sentences.chinese: 《道德經》，引述時標記的數位指的是每一節的編號。

sentences.english: Can foreigners understand Dao De Jing?
sentences.chinese: 外國人能讀懂道德經嗎？

sentences.english: The book, Tao Te Ching, has been translated into many languages.
sentences.chinese: 他寫的《道德經》被譯成許多種不同的文字。

sentences.english: And what does the Dao De Jing say about this?
sentences.chinese: 對此，《道德經》怎樣說的呢？

definition: The Book of Changes ("I Ching")
Zhuangzi (369-286 BC), Daoist author
The Analects of Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
Four Books, namely: the Great Learning 大學|大学, the Doctrine of the Mean 中庸, the Analects of Confucius 論語|论语, and Mencius 孟子
The Yellow Emperor's Internal Canon, medical text c. 300 BC
Classic of Rites
Records of the Grand Historian, by 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1], first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3]
marginal notes/annotation/to annotate/to add comments to text
saint/sage/refers to Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]/the current reigning Emperor
Holy Bible/the Confucian classics/CL:本[ben3],部[bu4]
Shijing, the Book of Songs, early collection of Chinese poems and one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1]
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls
Sima Qian (145-86 BC), Han Dynasty historian, author of Records of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4], known as the father of Chinese historiography

Six Classics, namely: Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], Book of History 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], Book of Rites 儀禮|仪礼[Yi2 li3], the lost Book of Music 樂經|乐经[Yue4 jing1], Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1]
entire book/unabridged book/entire multi-volume work/comprehensive volume

the Confucian Six Arts, namely: rites or etiquette 禮|礼[li3] (禮儀|礼仪[li3 yi2]), music 樂|乐[yue3] (音樂|音乐[yin1 yue4]), archery 射[she4] (射箭[she4 jian4]), charioteering 御[yu4] (駕車|驾车[jia4 che1]), calligraphy or literacy 書|书[shu1] (識字|识字[shi2 zi4]), mathematics or reckoning 數|数[shu4] (計算|计算[ji4 suan4])/another name for the Six Classics 六經|六经[Liu4 jing1]
